706157f-a.title: Brooklyn: Avenue P - Coleman Street
706157f-a.text:
4115-4130 AVe. P, north side, between Coleman (left) and Hendrickson
Streets, showing promminently the Lott Vanderveer house (left), No. 4130, at
the N.E. corner of Ave. P.
April 1926.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706159f-b.title: Brooklyn: Avenue P - Coleman Street
706159f-b.text:
(1)
413O Ave. P, at the N.E. corner of Coleman Street, formerly known
as 1745 Coleman Street, showing the Lott-Vanderveer House, built by
D. Lott in 1798 on Lott's Lane; occupied by Mra. Anna Lott in 1880 by Mr.
Frederick Boyd Stevenson of the Brooklyn Daily Eagle in 1923.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, from another angle.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

703702f-a.title: Brooklyn: Coleman Street - Avenue P
703702f-a.text:
(1)
Coleman Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Ave. P, showing
the Lott-Vanderveer house; erected by Henry D. Lott of Lotts Lane, in
1798. This house originally stood on Flatbush Road, with an additional
wing, and was occupied by Mrs. A. Lott, 1860-1873; and Fred Boyd Steven-
son in 1926. The house on the left, is 1565 Coleman Street, while the
building on the right, is No. 4115 Ave. P.
April 1926.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, a closeup of the north wing of the house.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
